title: Create consoul-sdk package structure
description:
**As a** SDK user
**I want** standalone consoul-sdk PyPI package
**So that** I can install SDK without TUI/CLI dependencies

**Context:**
After service layer is stable (EPIC-012 complete), extract SDK into standalone package. This enables lightweight installations for backend/script usage without Textual, Click, or UI dependencies.

**Package Contents:**
- consoul.sdk.services (ConversationService, ToolService, ModelService)
- consoul.ai (providers, tools, history, streaming)
- consoul.config (core config only, no TUI)
- consoul.utils (security, docs_generator)
- consoul.formatters

**Dependencies:**
- LangChain ecosystem (required)
- Pydantic + pydantic-settings (required)
- tiktoken, requests, etc. (required)
- NO Textual, NO Click, NO Rich (optional/excluded)

**Technical Notes:**
- Create: packages/consoul-sdk/pyproject.toml
- Create: packages/consoul-sdk/src/consoul_sdk/
- Move: SDK code from main project
- Define: Public API in __init__.py
- Setup: CI/CD for SDK package
- Publish: To PyPI as consoul-sdk
- Dependencies: EPIC-012 must be complete

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** SDK package structure created
**When** I pip install consoul-sdk
**Then** Only SDK code and dependencies are installed

**Given** SDK installed
**When** I import from consoul_sdk
**Then** All services are available

**Given** Backend usage
**When** Using SDK in FastAPI app
**Then** No TUI/CLI code is imported

**Given** Package published
**When** Running pip install consoul-sdk
**Then** Installation is <50MB (vs ~200MB with TUI)

**Implementation Hints:**
- Use pyproject.toml with Poetry
- Define extras for optional features (pdf, ollama-library)
- Version independently from CLI/TUI
- Export clean public API: from consoul_sdk import ConversationService, etc.
- Setup automated testing in CI
- Document installation and import patterns
- Consider semver versioning strategy
- Add package to PyPI
